result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon Zapien-Gamino

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ramon Zapien-Gamino in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Ramon Zapien-Gamino.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Sarah Chwaszczewski. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This hearing will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ramon Zapien-Gamino in court with Attorney Michael Reyes.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez. 
Case in court for status hearing following case #18CF5240.  Court set a plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-10-2022

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelon, Br. 40.

Defendant Ramon Zapien-Gamino in court with attorney Michael Reyes, appear in person.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case retabbed to Branch 45 Lower number case pending.  Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Staus to Branch 40.  Status hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 050046,
Payable Number: 1009274,
Receipt Number: 22RP021517,
Amount: $20.00
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-25-2022

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 4 Supervision.   
Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.
No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5/18/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

ADDRESS INFO for Ramon Zapien-Gamino
Current: 1237 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 05-16-2022)
Prior: 1247 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Ramon Zapien-Gamino in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@2:00pm
